@graph.name: EuroCheck
@graph.description: Find European products and EU alternatives with our free browser extension. Know which online shops are European-owned.

@graph.name: EuroCheck FAQ
@graph.description: Frequently asked questions about EuroCheck browser extension

mainEntity.name: How accurate is EuroCheck's company ownership data?

acceptedAnswer.text: We research ownership structures using public filings, company registries, and verified sources. Our database covers 321 companies and growing. When ownership is genuinely complex (joint ventures, partial acquisitions), we mark it as 'mixed' rather than guess.
None. EuroCheck runs entirely in your browser using a local database. We have no servers tracking your browsing, no analytics, no telemetry. We couldn't see your data even if we wanted to.
Currently Chrome, Firefox, and other Chromium-based browsers (Edge, Brave, Opera). Safari support is planned.
Yes, completely free. No premium tiers, no 'pro' version, no catch. EuroCheck is a community project built to empower consumers, not monetize them.

mainEntity.name: How do I find European alternatives to US products?

acceptedAnswer.text: EuroCheck automatically shows you when you're on a non-EU website. Install the extension and you'll always know if you're buying European or not. We're also working on features to suggest European alternatives.

mainEntity.name: Why should I buy European products?

acceptedAnswer.text: Buying European supports local jobs, ensures stronger consumer protections under EU law, typically means better privacy (GDPR), and often results in lower environmental impact due to shorter shipping distances.

mainEntity.name: How can I contribute to EuroCheck?

acceptedAnswer.text: You can submit new companies or corrections via GitHub, report inaccuracies through our feedback form, contribute code if you're a developer, or simply spread the word about the project.
